mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Mecyclothorax beetles (Coleoptera, Carabidae, Moriomorphini) of Tahiti, Society Islands

subSubSection.paragraph: Among species of the Mecyclothorax dannieae group, this species uniquely lacks dorsal elytral setae. The apical elytral setae are polymorphic in the single known specimen, with both apical and subapical setae on the right elytron, only the apical seta on the left; therefore the setal formula is 220(1-2). The discal elytral striae 1-5 are distinctly punctate in the basal half (Fig. 25A), the punctures elongate and expanding the strial breadth. The convexity of the eighth elytral interval equals that of the seventh, with a subcarinate ridge parallel to and near the seventh stria. The head bears evident microsculpture in depressed areas and wrinkles, with the isodiametric and transverse sculpticells on the frons arranged in a transverse mesh, the arrangement more isodiametric on the neck. The pronotal disc and discal elytral intervals have well-developed transverse microsculpture, a mixture of transverse lines and transverse mesh, the mesh comprising sculpticells with breadth 2 -3x length. The male aedeagal median lobe is slender basally, and expanded both ventrally and dorsally at its apex (Fig. 27A), with the dorsal expansion more tightly rounded than the ventral. Standardized body length 4.3 mm.
The male holotype and only known specimen was collected between 900 and 1100 m elevation on Mont Marau.
